Properties.ReadAloud: The next questions are about your use of alcohol – beer, wine, wine coolers, or hard liquors like vodka, gin, or whiskey. Each can or bottle of beer, glass of wine or wine cooler, shot of liquor, or mixed drink with liquor in it counts as one drink.   Not including sips from another person’s drink, have you ever, in your whole life, even once, had a drink?
How old were you the first time you had a drink?
Properties.Advice: CODE AGE

Properties.PostFormula: IF [AGE/GRADE] GIVEN WAS CHILD’S CURRENT [AGE/GRADE], GO TO Q 1D   IF [AGE/GRADE] GIVEN WAS CHILD’S CURRENT [AGE/GRADE] MINUS 1, GO TO Q 1B   ALL OTHERS, GO TO Q 1C
Properties.ReadAloud: IF AGE NOT KNOWN, ASK: What grade were you in?
Properties.Advice: CODE GRADE (44 = PRE-K, 55 = KINDERGARTEN, 13 = COLLEGE FRESHMAN, 14 = SOPHOMORE, 15 = JUNIOR, 16 = SENIOR, 17 = POST B.A.)

Properties.ReadAloud: Was that more than a year ago – that is, before [[NAME EVENT]/ [NAME CURRENT MONTH] of last year]?
TNow, think about the last year – that is, since [[NAME EVENT]/[NAME CURRENT MONTH] of last year]. Have you had a drink in the last year?
In the last year, were there six or more days when you had a drink?
Thinking about your whole life, were there six or more days when you had a drink?
Was there ever a single year when you drank on six or more days?
In the last year, about how many weeks did you have something to drink? Was it almost every week … more than half the weeks … about half the weeks … one week a month … or less than one week a month?

Properties.ReadAloud: Did you have something to drink in the last four weeks – that is, since [[NAME EVENT]//the beginning of/the middle of/the end of [LAST MONTH]]?
When did you last have a drink?
Properties.Advice: CODE MONTH (00 = CURRENT MONTH)

Properties.ReadAloud: During weeks in the last year when you’ve had something to drink, how many drinks in total would you usually have from Friday through Sunday – adding together beers, glasses of wine, straight or mixed liquor, and wine coolers?
Properties.Advice: CODE NUMBER OF DRINKS (66 = 66 OR MORE DRINKS)

Properties.ReadAloud: And how many drinks would you usually have in total from Monday through Thursday?
Properties.Advice: CODE NUMBER OF DRINKS (66 = 66 OR MORE DRINKS)

Properties.ReadAloud: In the last year, was there ever a time when you had at least 4 drinks within a 2-3 hour period?
What is the most amount of drinks you’ve had within a 2-3-hour period?
Properties.Advice: CODE NUMBER OF DRINKS (66 = 66 OR MORE DRINKS)

Properties.ReadAloud: In the last year, was there ever a month when you drank on at least six days?
How old were you the first time you got drunk – that is, your speech was slurred or you were unsteady on your feet?
Properties.Advice: CODE AGE (88 = NEVER)

Properties.ReadAloud: IF AGE NOT KNOWN, ASK: What grade were you in?
Properties.Advice: CODE GRADE (44 = PRE-K, 55 = KINDERGARTEN, 13 = COLLEGE FRESHMAN, 14 = SOPHOMORE, 15 = JUNIOR, 16 = SENIOR, 17 = POST B.A.)

Properties.ReadAloud: THIS IS AN OPTIONAL SKIP  WOULD YOU LIKE TO ASK ABOUT CRITERIA FOR ALCOHOL USE DISORDER?
In the last year – that is, since [NAME CURRENT MONTH] of last year – did you miss [school/work] to go drinking or because you were hungover?
Did you miss [school/work] more than once because of drinking?
(In the last year), did you go to [school/work] right after you had been drinking or drink while you were at [school/work]?
Did you do this more than once?
(In the last year), did you get into trouble at [school/work] or did you have problems [with your schoolwork/doing your job] because of drinking?
Did this happen more than once?
In the last year, did you drink before you did something important or while you were doing something important ... like babysitting or working?
Did you do this more than once?
WERE ONE OR MORE § RESPONSES OR TWO OR MORE * RESPONSES CODED IN Q 2–5?
(In the last year), did you get into arguments with your family or friends because of how you act when you drink?

Properties.Description: Even though you had problems with your family or friends, did you drink anyway?
(In the last year, (that is, since [NAME CURRENT MONTH] of last year)), did any of your friends not want to be with you because of the way you act when you are drinking?
Even though your friends didn’t want to be with you, did you drink anyway?
In the last year, did you get into any physical ﬁghts when you had been drinking?
Did this happen more than once?

Properties.ReadAloud: Even though you got into physical fights, did you drink alcohol anyway?
WERE ONE OR MORE § RESPONSES CODED IN Q 6–8?

Properties.Description: (In the last year), did you ever drink in situations where you could get hurt, like right before or while you were riding a bike, swimming or driving a car or motorcycle?
Did you do this more than once?
(In the last year), did you get in trouble with the police when you were drunk or because you had been drinking?
Did this happen more than once?

Properties.ReadAloud: In the last year – that is, since [NAME CURRENT MONTH] of last year – did you often drink more than you intended to?

Properties.Description: Did you often end up drinking for a longer time than you had planned?
(In the last year), have you often felt that you should quit or cut down on your drinking?
(In the last year), did you ever try to quit or cut down on drinking?
When you tried to quit or cut down on drinking, did you ever find that you were unable to do so?

Properties.ReadAloud: Did this happen more than once?
(In the last year), could you drink a lot more alcohol than you used to before you got drunk?
Did it seem like the same amount had less effect on you?
In the last year, were there many days when you felt sick or hungover after drinking?
In the last year, did you spend a lot of your time drinking?
In the last year, did you spend a lot of time planning how you would get alcohol?
(In the last year, (that is, since [NAME CURRENT MONTH] of last year)), did you feel such a strong desire or urge to drink that you could not keep from drinking?
Did you ever want a drink so badly that you could not think about anything else?

Properties.PostFormula: IF NOT ENROLLED IN SCHOOL OR HOMESCHOOL OR DOES NOT HAVE A JOB GO TO Q 19.  ALL OTHERS, CONTINUE
Properties.ReadAloud: (In the last year), were there important social or recreational things you cut down on or did not do because of drinking, for example, things like participating in hobbies or sports or going to social or family events?
Were there important things at [school/work] that you didn’t do because of drinking?
Did you stop going to [school/work] because of drinking?
WERE ONE OR MORE § RESPONSES CODED IN Q 17–18?
In the last year, did drinking cause you to have any physical health problems or did drinking make a health problem worse?
Did you continue drinking even though it was causing you a physical problem?
(In the last year), did drinking cause you to get sad or depressed or very irritable?
Did you continue to drink even though it made you feel this way?
(In the last year), did you ever discover you couldn’t remember things you had said or done while you were drinking?
Did this happen several times?
WERE ONE OR MORE § RESPONSES CODED IN Q 19–21?
In the last year, when you didn’t drink or when you cut down, did you feel bad or feel sick?
Now I want to ask you about things that may have happened in the last year when you didn’t drink or when you cut down on drinking.Did you become nervous or worried?
When you didn’t drink or when you cut down, did you feel restless, like you couldn’t sit still?
(When you didn’t drink or when you cut down), did you feel your heart beating fast?
(When you didn’t drink or when you cut down), did you sweat a lot?
WERE ONE OR MORE # RESPONSES CODED IN Q 22C OR 22D?
When you didn’t drink or when you cut down on drinking, did you feel sick to your stomach or have to vomit or throw up?
(When you didn’t drink or when you cut down), did you have trouble sleeping?
When you didn’t drink or when you cut down on drinking, did you get headaches?
When you didn’t drink or when you cut down on drinking, did you feel weak?
(When you didn’t drink or when you cut down), did you ever have any ﬁts or seizures?
When you didn’t drink or when you cut down on drinking, did your hands shake?
(When you didn’t drink or when you cut down), did your tongue tremble or did your eyes twitch?
When you didn’t drink or when you cut down on drinking, did you see, feel, or hear things that other people couldn’t?

In the last year – that is, since [NAME CURRENT MONTH] of last year – did you ever drink alcohol or take medicines like tranquilizers or sedatives so that you wouldn’t feel bad or sick after you had been drinking a lot?

WERE 2 OR MORE RESPONSES CODED IN Q 22A–22L AND NOTE 6 OR ONE RESPONSE CODED IN Q23?   IF YES: INTERVIEWER: NAME THIS BACK AS [felt bad or sick when you didn’t drink or cut down/drank or took medicine to keep from feeling bad or sick] IN Q24

You said that in the last year you [NAME [ ] SYMPTOMS IN Q 2–20 AND NOTES 2-7].Now, what about the last four weeks?  In the last four weeks – that is, since [[NAME EVENT]//the beginning of/the middle of/the end of [LAST MONTH]] -- have you done things like this?
How old were you the first time you [did things like that/felt like that] because of drinking?
